title.value: Empirical Study on Optimizer Selection for Out-of-Distribution Generalization
title.justification: Title located at the top of the research paper
title.quote: Empirical Study on Optimizer Selection for Out-of-Distribution Generalization

extractions.description: This study examines the performance of popular first-order optimizers for various classes of distributional shift under empirical risk minimization and invariant risk minimization. It addresses problems in image and text classification using DomainBed, WILDS, and Backgrounds Challenge as out-of-distribution datasets, with hyperparameters tuned across over 20,000 models.

type.justification: The study involves extensive experimentation and data analysis.
type.quote: In this study, we examine the performance of popular first-order optimizers for different classes of distributional shift under empirical risk minimization and invariant risk minimization.

name.justification: The focus of the study is on the performance of different optimizers for machine learning models under various conditions.
name.quote: Selecting an appropriate optimizer is crucial for the successful training of deep neural networks.

name.justification: The study includes exhaustive experiments on image classification datasets like DomainBed and Backgrounds Challenge.
name.quote: We use DomainBed (which includes seven image datasets) [GL21], Backgrounds Challenge dataset [Xia+21].

name.justification: The study also applies experimental analysis on text classification datasets such as Amazon-WILDS and CivilComments-WILDS.
name.quote: Amazon-WILDS and CivilComments-WILDS as out-of-distribution datasets.

name.justification: DomainBed dataset includes seven image datasets and is used extensively in the experiments.
name.quote: We use DomainBed (which includes seven image datasets) [GL21], Backgrounds Challenge dataset [Xia+21], Amazon-WILDS, and CivilComments-WILDS [Koh+21] for the benchmarks.
